title: Blended Learning-Based Systematic Literature Review Training for Enhancing Medical Research Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology and Research Methodology Knowledge
context.additional_context: Participants have no prior experience in systematic literature review paper writing and learn in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment. A summative assessment evaluates knowledge acquisition and satisfaction post-course.

learning_goals: Explain the core stages of a systematic literature review: problem definition, literature search, data analysis, and result interpretation
Apply techniques to efficiently search relevant literature in medical databases (e.g., PubMed, KoreaMed)
Perform critical evaluations based on search results and write structured abstracts

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
